Asia's Gen Z rises up against entrenched political elites
subhead: Since 2022, young people in Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and Nepal have led a wave of uprisings to demand radical change, united by a common cause: frustration with politicians' corruption and self-granted privileges.

title: Trump announces Gaza peace plan with Netanyahu's backing
JD Vance says US government 'headed to a shutdown,' blames Democrats
'Between Argentina and the US, bad accounts make for good friends'
subhead: Donald Trump pledged his unconditional support for Javier Milei's administration as it faces pressure from financial markets on the peso. However, this initiative primarily signals ideological solidarity – one that may ultimately be costly for Argentinians, writes Stéphane Lauer.

title: Zucman tax: 'The super-rich pay significantly fewer taxes than their fellow citizens, and yet extreme wealth is almost always tied to business'
subhead: Former MPs Gilles Carrez (Les Républicains, right-wing) and Valérie Rabault (Parti Socialiste, left-wing) share a desire for fiscal fairness, but in this op-ed for Le Monde, they highlight the issue of funds from accumulated, undistributed dividends that, after corporate tax is paid, escape all personal taxation.

title: In Greece, an abbot is arrested for trafficking religious artifacts
subhead: Affiliated with the monastery of Kalavryta, in the Peloponnese, the clergyman was caught as he attempted to sell 14 Byzantine icons and two 18th-century Gospels for the sum of €200,000.

title: Charlie Kirk's memorial through the lens of photographer Stacy Kranitz: 'The first few hours felt like a megachurch service'
subhead: Stacy Kranitz, an American photographer born in 1974, covered the memorial ceremony for the ultraconservative activist on September 21 for Le Monde. She reflects on this spectacular event, which combined politics with religion.

subhead: Activists are calling to build a monument in Paris to honor the women who died from unsafe abortions before abortion was legalized in France in 1975.

title: Svalbard, the fastest-warming place on Earth
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (1/6). The Norwegian archipelago has warmed by 4°C over the past 30 years. Landslides and thawing permafrost threaten the population, whose way of life is highly greenhouse gas-intensive.

title: How can Europe withstand pressure from Russia and the US? Two experts debate
subhead: Tensions with Russia to the East and the United States to the West are testing Europe's model. Sylvain Kahn and Guillaume Lagane examine this shifting landscape and the possible responses.
